name: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania v. Carmen Stephen VENAFRA, Appellant; COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania v. John TULLY, Appellant

judges: Before O’BRIEN, C. J., and ROBERTS, NIX, LARSEN, FLAHERTY, and KAUFFMAN, JJ.
parties: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania v. Carmen Stephen VENAFRA, Appellant. COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania v. John TULLY, Appellant.

opinions.text:
OPINION OF THE COURT
PER CURIAM:
The appeal is dismissed, 260 Pa. Super. 595, 394 A.2d 614, as being improvidently granted.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: John Rogers Carroll, Philadelphia, C. Barry Buckley, West Chester, Thomas Carroll, Philadelphia, for appellant.
Janet L. Crawford, Asst. Dist. Atty., Alan Jarvis, West Chester, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
425 A.2d 745
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania v. Carmen Stephen VENAFRA, Appellant. COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania v. John TULLY, Appellant.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Jan. 23, 1981.
Decided Feb. 27, 1981.
John Rogers Carroll, Philadelphia, C. Barry Buckley, West Chester, Thomas Carroll, Philadelphia, for appellant.
Janet L. Crawford, Asst. Dist. Atty., Alan Jarvis, West Chester, for appellee.
Before O’BRIEN, C. J., and ROBERTS, NIX, LARSEN, FLAHERTY, and KAUFFMAN, JJ.
